verb: žabaw b-ičː-i / b-ulučː-i (to 3 pers.); žabaw čː-i / lučː-i (to 1 and 2 pers.)
comms_internal: CV. Alternative is the construction with the same verb form, but with the pattern ERG_DAT: durħaˤ-li tatːi-j žabaw-b-ičː-ib [boy-erg father-dat answer-n-give.pfv-pret(3)]. The pattern with INTER(LAT) was chosen mainly because it is also observed in most other verbs of speech. Generally speaking, «the dative case marks the recipient for verbs of permanent transfer of concrete things. Spatial case are used for the transfer of abstract things and temporary transfers».
